titlestmt.titleproper: RG 028:003, Commission to Study the Integration of the State Judicial System, 1943-1945

did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Connecticut. Commission to Study the Integration of the State Judicial System

did.unittitle: Commission to Study the Integration of the State Judicial System records
did.abstract: The Commission studied the State's judicial system with regards to methods of appointment of judges and their tenure in office and salaries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1943 the General Assembly authorized the appointment of a ten-member commission, “to study the integration and reorganization of the judicial system of the state, including…[the courts, the probate courts, etc.] to determine the most efficient and economical methods of integrating and reorganizing the same into one judicial system, including, but not limited to, methods of appointment of judges and such commissioners and their tenure of office and salaries.” Judge Newell Jennings became chairman and Edward C. Fisher of the Judicial Department served as secretary.

Depending largely on data, statistics and information already available from the Judicial Department and from other states, the Commission held a series of meetings beginning on July 9, 1943 and ending on December 11, 1944. Its report was adopted on July 10, 1944 and published, along with several members' dissents and comments, in 1945. A copy is with the records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes minutes, bulletins, reports and correspondence.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: RG 028:001, Commission to Investigate the Advisability of COnsolidating Certain State Boards and Commission and to Investigate the Public Health Laws, 1915.
RG 028:002, Commission on Reorganization of State Departments, 1935-1937.
RG 028:004, Commission on State Government Organization, 1949-1950.
RG 028:005, Commission on Services and Expenditures (Etherington Commission), 1971.
RG 028:006, Committee on the Structure of State Government (Filer Committee), 1975-1977.
RG 028:008, Governor's Study Group on Limitation on Expenditures, 1978-1979.
RG 028:009, Commission to Study the Management of State Government (Thomas Commission), 1989-1991.
RG 028:010, Commission to Effect Government Reorganisation (Hull-Harper Commission), 1991-1992.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: These records were formerly RG 90. In 1994, State Archives staff consolidated the collection with other records of similar commissions in a new RG 28.

scopecontent.p: One binder including a copy of hte act authorizing the commission, a list of members, a speech by the chairman to the State Bar Association describing the commission's work (October 9, 1943), minutes of meetings, bulletins (notices of meetings, proposals), and miscellanous bulletins, drafts and background material.
Record of a public hearing on questions being considered by the commission.
Statistical material on the work and costs of the probate courts, with reports and draft recommendations for the commission's report on the subject.
Correspondence, drafts, memoranda, notes and reference materials pertaining to the commission's work and the distribution of its report. some papers apparaently came from the Governor's files.
